ticket.title: Rails 3 RC Routing: resource member routes lack defaults
ticket.original-body:
When adding additional actions to a resource as shown in 2.9 of the routing guide (http://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/routing.html), the action and route naming is not done by default. For example, placing the example code in a fresh app and running `rake routes` raises an error "missing :action" This can be fixed by changing the line to `get 'preview', :action=>'preview', :as=>:preview.
Expected behavior: 1) The example code should parse 2) the action and route name should be inferred
ticket.latest-body:
When adding additional actions to a resource as shown in 2.9 of the routing guide (http://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/routing.html), the action and route naming is not done by default. For example, placing the example code in a fresh app and running `rake routes` raises an error "missing :action" This can be fixed by changing the line to `get 'preview', :action=>'preview', :as=>:preview.
Expected behavior: 1) The example code should parse 2) the action and route name should be inferred
ticket.original-body-html:
When adding additional actions to a resource as shown in 2.9 of the routing guide (http://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/routing.html), the action and route naming is not done by default. For example, placing the example code in a fresh app and running rake routes raises an error "missing :action" This can be fixed by changing the line to get 'preview', :action=>'preview', :as=>:preview.

Expected behavior:
1) The example code should parse
2) the action and route name should be inferred

version.body:
When adding additional actions to a resource as shown in 2.9 of the routing guide (http://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/routing.html), the action and route naming is not done by default. For example, placing the example code in a fresh app and running `rake routes` raises an error "missing :action" This can be fixed by changing the line to `get 'preview', :action=>'preview', :as=>:preview.
Expected behavior: 1) The example code should parse 2) the action and route name should be inferred
version.body-html:
When adding additional actions to a resource as shown in 2.9 of the routing guide (http://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/routing.html), the action and route naming is not done by default. For example, placing the example code in a fresh app and running rake routes raises an error "missing :action" This can be fixed by changing the line to get 'preview', :action=>'preview', :as=>:preview.

Expected behavior:
1) The example code should parse
2) the action and route name should be inferred
version.title: Rails 3 RC Routing: resource member routes lack defaults

version.body: I can't reproduce this, can you provide more info, try doing a test case or upload an application?. Thanks.
version.body-html:
I can't reproduce this, can you provide more info, try doing a test case or upload an application?.
Thanks.
version.title: Rails 3 RC Routing: resource member routes lack defaults

version.body:
I think the problem is the guide shows the example using a string, whereas it should really be a symbol. I can't reproduce the missing action error but it is correct that the route isn't named.
The action is added [here](http://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/actionpack/lib/action_dispatch/routing/mapper.rb#L739), however I leaning towards thinking that it should removed and require the action to be specified. The problem with adding the action and name by default when specifying a custom action as a string is that you can add extra parameters in the path so you should really be adding all the options. e.g:
@@@ ruby resources :photos do get 'preview/:size', :on => :member end @@@
It wouldn't add too much overhead to add a regexp check on the name to see if it's compatible with adding it by default I guess, but the guide definitely needs updating.
version.body-html:
I think the problem is the guide shows the example using a string, whereas it should really be a symbol. I can't reproduce the missing action error but it is correct that the route isn't named.

The action is added here, however I leaning towards thinking that it should removed and require the action to be specified. The problem with adding the action and name by default when specifying a custom action as a string is that you can add extra parameters in the path so you should really be adding all the options. e.g:

resources :photos do
  get 'preview/:size', :on => :member
end

It wouldn't add too much overhead to add a regexp check on the name to see if it's compatible with adding it by default I guess, but the guide definitely needs updating.
version.title: Rails 3 RC Routing: resource member routes lack defaults

version.body: Okay, here's a patch to add a default name and action if the string is just alphanumeric.
version.body-html: Okay, here's a patch to add a default name and action if the string is just alphanumeric.
version.title: Rails 3 RC Routing: resource member routes lack defaults

version.body: I should be sleepy when i watched to this but i agree with Andrew, also +1 for the patch. Just wait for José resolution :).
version.body-html:
I should be sleepy when i watched to this but i agree with Andrew, also +1 for the patch.
Just wait for José resolution :).
version.title: Rails 3 RC Routing: resource member routes lack defaults

version.body: (from [7a7012c7177fd9811305c03b1db0ec0d5008f19e]) Fix a bug where symbols and strings were not behaving the same in the router. [#5431 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/7a7012c7177fd9811305c03b1db0ec0d5008f19e
version.body-html: (from [7a7012c7177fd9811305c03b1db0ec0d5008f19e]) Fix a bug where symbols and strings were not behaving the same in the router. [#5431 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/7a7012c7177fd9811305c03b1db0ec...
version.title: Rails 3 RC Routing: resource member routes lack defaults

version.body:
(from [8feb2856ea1e813bdefe64e9820cd1005aa5ad92]) When custom resource actions are specified using strings add the default name and action if the string is a valid ruby method name.
[#5431 state:resolved]
Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/8feb2856ea1e813bdefe64e9820cd1005aa5ad92
version.body-html:
(from [8feb2856ea1e813bdefe64e9820cd1005aa5ad92]) When custom resource actions are specified using strings add the default name and action if the string is a valid ruby method name.

[#5431 state:resolved]

Signed-off-by: José Valim jose.valim@gmail.com
http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/8feb2856ea1e813bdefe64e9820cd1...
